title: Pakistan: Imran Khan's party yet to get permission for Sunday rally
Laura Loomer now asks What Kamala Harris' religion is. 'Has anyone asked her?'
content: Far-right activist Laura Loomer questioned Kamala Harris' religion after she confirmed she would skip the AI Smith dinner on October 17. Loomer's controversial remarks about Harris' ethnicity were condemned by Republicans and distanced by Donald Trump. Harris has a unique religious identity, having been introduced to both Hinduism and Christianity, as she said earlier.
summary: Far-right activist Laura Loomer questioned Kamala Harris' religion after she confirmed she would skip the AI Smith dinner on October 17. Loomer's controversial remarks about Harris' ethnicity were condemned by Republicans and distanced by Donald Trump. Harris has a unique religious identity, having been introduced to both Hinduism and Christianity, as she said earlier.

title: Hurricane Helene traps families, leaves North Carolina mountain towns in ruins
content: Hurricane Helene's impact on North Carolina's mountain regions has left families isolated due to landslides and flooding. The storm made landfall in Florida and caused at least 52 fatalities across five states. Major roadways are closed, with preliminary damage estimates ranging from $15 billion to $26 billion.
summary: Hurricane Helene's impact on North Carolina's mountain regions has left families isolated due to landslides and flooding. The storm made landfall in Florida and caused at least 52 fatalities across five states. Major roadways are closed, with preliminary damage estimates ranging from $15 billion to $26 billion.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu presents maps at UN, labels India a 'blessing' and Iran a 'curse'
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the UN General Assembly, displaying two maps one as a "blessing" and the other as a "curse. He described the map titled 'The Curse' featured Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Yemen colored in black, while the map labeled 'The Blessing' highlighted Egypt, Sudan, Saudi Arabia, and India in green.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the UN General Assembly, displaying two maps one as a "blessing" and the other as a "curse. He described the map titled 'The Curse' featured Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Yemen colored in black, while the map labeled 'The Blessing' highlighted Egypt, Sudan, Saudi Arabia, and India in green.

title: This Republican politician 'borrows' wife and children for photoshoot
content: Republican Derrick Anderson, running for Virginia's seventh congressional district, faced backlash after using a friend's family in a campaign photoshoot. Anderson, who is engaged and childless, defended the footage as featuring supporters. This incident sparked social media criticism and highlighted GOP efforts to attract female voters amid ongoing abortion debates.
summary: Republican Derrick Anderson, running for Virginia's seventh congressional district, faced backlash after using a friend's family in a campaign photoshoot. Anderson, who is engaged and childless, defended the footage as featuring supporters. This incident sparked social media criticism and highlighted GOP efforts to attract female voters amid ongoing abortion debates.

title: Queen Camilla does not want King Charles to meet Prince Harry because...
content: ​The King send a birthday wish to Prince Harry as the prince turned 40 hinting at a thawing of their relationship caused by the hurt that Prince Harry delivered by badmouthing the Royal Family and then quitting the royal responsibilities. But a public birthday wish is the most King Charles would do, a meeting may not happen but nobody is ruling out a meeting as well.
summary: ​The King send a birthday wish to Prince Harry as the prince turned 40 hinting at a thawing of their relationship caused by the hurt that Prince Harry delivered by badmouthing the Royal Family and then quitting the royal responsibilities. But a public birthday wish is the most King Charles would do, a meeting may not happen but nobody is ruling out a meeting as well.

title: Senior Iran Guards general Abbas Nilforushan killed alongside Hezbollah leader Nasrallah in Israel-Lebanon strike: State media
Titan sub tragedy: Coast guard hearings reveal new insights
Video: How Israel executed operation 'New Order' to kill Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut
content: Israel executed airstrikes on Hezbollah positions in Lebanon, targeting over 140 sites and killing multiple commanders, including leader Hassan Nasrallah. Iranian deputy commander Abbas Nilforushan was also among the casualties. This week has seen one of the deadliest escalations since the 2006 war between Israel and Hezbollah, with over 700 deaths reported.
summary: Israel executed airstrikes on Hezbollah positions in Lebanon, targeting over 140 sites and killing multiple commanders, including leader Hassan Nasrallah. Iranian deputy commander Abbas Nilforushan was also among the casualties. This week has seen one of the deadliest escalations since the 2006 war between Israel and Hezbollah, with over 700 deaths reported.

title: Mass shootings in South Africa leaves seventeen dead in same town
content: Seventeen people were killed in two separate mass shootings on Friday night in Lusikisiki, South Africa. The victims included 15 women and two men. “A manhunt has been launched to apprehend those behind these heinous killings,” Brig. Athlenda Mathe said. These incidents underscore South Africa's high homicide rate and increasing frequency of mass shootings.
summary: Seventeen people were killed in two separate mass shootings on Friday night in Lusikisiki, South Africa. The victims included 15 women and two men. “A manhunt has been launched to apprehend those behind these heinous killings,”  Brig. Athlenda Mathe said. These incidents underscore South Africa's high homicide rate and increasing frequency of mass shootings.

title: Tulsi Gabbard calls Kamala Harris shameless as VP inspects US-Mexico border: 'No conscience'
content: Kamala Harris visited Arizona's border with Mexico for the first time since becoming the Democratic presidential nominee, pledging to secure the border and reform immigration. Critics, including Tulsi Gabbard and JD Vance, dismissed it as a photo op and questioned why she hasn't already addressed these issues as Vice President.
summary: Kamala Harris visited Arizona's border with Mexico for the first time since becoming the Democratic presidential nominee, pledging to secure the border and reform immigration. Critics, including Tulsi Gabbard and JD Vance, dismissed it as a photo op and questioned why she hasn't already addressed these issues as Vice President.

title: Kamala Harris' sister says she will call her 'Madam President' when she's elected, 'Until then...'
content: 57-year-old Maya, a lawyer and a public policy advisor, said she is very proud to be part of Kamala Harris' presidential campaign and the feeling is extraordinary, electric. "I am just so proud to be able to be out there in these states encouraging people to knock on every door, call every voter, text their friends and family members between now and Election Day, to really have those personal conversations that help people learn who Kamala is, what she's fighting for, why they believe in her," Maya told People magazine.
summary: 57-year-old Maya, a lawyer and a public policy advisor, said she is very proud to be part of Kamala Harris' presidential campaign and the feeling is extraordinary, electric. "I am just so proud to be able to be out there in these states encouraging people to knock on every door, call every voter, text their friends and family members between now and Election Day, to really have those personal conversations that help people learn who Kamala is, what she's fighting for, why they believe in her," Maya told People magazine.

title: RFK Jr and Olivia Nuzzi had 'incredible' FaceTime sex: Report
content: The new revelation that they had FaceTime sex is part of the charges that the two camps are lobbing at each other. Sources told Page Six that Nuzzi was first disgusted by Kennedy Jr after he made a clumsy pass at her. But then Kennedy Jr "love bombed" her which went well and Nuzzi was "madly in love" with him. There were long calls, endless texts and virtual sex which ruined Nuzzi's relationship with her fiance Ryan Lizza, who was a journalist with Politico.
summary: The new revelation that they had FaceTime sex is part of the charges that the two camps are lobbing at each other. Sources told Page Six that Nuzzi was first disgusted by Kennedy Jr after he made a clumsy pass at her. But then Kennedy Jr "love bombed" her which went well and Nuzzi was "madly in love" with him. There were long calls, endless texts and virtual sex which ruined Nuzzi's relationship with her fiance Ryan Lizza, who was a journalist with Politico.

title: 'Drugged, raped for years': Sean 'Diddy' Combs faces new sexual assault lawsuit
content: Sean 'Diddy' Combs, detained in Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Centre, faces fresh sexual assault allegations from a former model who claims he drugged and raped her since 2021. The lawsuit adds to existing complaints against him. Combs denies most allegations and remains incarcerated without bail as investigations continue.
summary: Sean 'Diddy' Combs, detained in Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Centre, faces fresh sexual assault allegations from a former model who claims he drugged and raped her since 2021. The lawsuit adds to existing complaints against him. Combs denies most allegations and remains incarcerated without bail as investigations continue.

title: Pakistan helicopter crash: 7 killed in North Waziristan, many injured
content: A helicopter crash in North Waziristan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, has led to seven fatalities and seven injuries. The chartered flight was transporting oil company employees when it experienced engine failure shortly after takeoff. The crash occurred during an emergency landing attempt. An investigation is ongoing to determine the cause of the technical fault.
summary: A helicopter crash in North Waziristan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, has led to seven fatalities and seven injuries. The chartered flight was transporting oil company employees when it experienced engine failure shortly after takeoff. The crash occurred during an emergency landing attempt. An investigation is ongoing to determine the cause of the technical fault.

title: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah dead: Who will lead militant group against Israeli aggression?
content: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death in an Israeli airstrike is expected to significantly impact the group he led for 32 years. The challenge of finding a successor is compounded by internal and external pressures. Israel's military is preparing for potential escalations as tensions with Lebanon continue to rise following recent conflicts.
summary: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death in an Israeli airstrike is expected to significantly impact the group he led for 32 years. The challenge of finding a successor is compounded by internal and external pressures. Israel's military is preparing for potential escalations as tensions with Lebanon continue to rise following recent conflicts.

title: US presidential elections: Kamala Harris vows to fix broken immigration system
content: Kamala Harris visited the southern border for the first time as a presidential candidate, vowing to fix the immigration system. She drew on her experience as California's Attorney General to emphasize border security and criticized Donald Trump's leadership. Trump responded by accusing Harris of failing to protect American communities from crime.
summary: Kamala Harris visited the southern border for the first time as a presidential candidate, vowing to fix the immigration system. She drew on her experience as California's Attorney General to emphasize border security and criticized Donald Trump's leadership. Trump responded by accusing Harris of failing to protect American communities from crime.

title: Georgia homeowner sues coun​ty after demolition of his property without court hearing
content: Georgia homeowner Eric Arnold is suing Macon-Bibb County officials for demolishing his property without a court hearing. Arnold bought the house in February 2022 and was renovating it when it was labeled an imminent threat to the community. Despite paying taxes and obtaining permits, the house was demolished in November 2023.
summary: Georgia homeowner Eric Arnold is suing Macon-Bibb County officials for demolishing his property without a court hearing. Arnold bought the house in February 2022 and was renovating it when it was labeled an imminent threat to the community. Despite paying taxes and obtaining permits, the house was demolished in November 2023.

title: Harris, Trump and tariffs: Who has got Asian nod
content: Kamala Harris is slightly ahead of Donald Trump in most polls, and Asian diplomats are leaning towards supporting her in the upcoming US presidential elections. Analysts suggest that import tariffs might be lower under Harris compared to Trump. However, uncertainty looms for businesses managing supply chains in Asean economies due to unclear foreign policies towards Asia.
summary: Kamala Harris is slightly ahead of Donald Trump in most polls, and Asian diplomats are leaning towards supporting her in the upcoming US presidential elections. Analysts suggest that import tariffs might be lower under Harris compared to Trump. However, uncertainty looms for businesses managing supply chains in Asean economies due to unclear foreign policies towards Asia.

title: 'Hot americano and an egg': Chinese employee fired for refusing to serve boss
content: In Shanghai, a new employee was briefly fired after refusing to buy breakfast for her supervisor. She shared her experience on social media, leading to public condemnation and the supervisor's termination. The company reinstated the employee and acknowledged that the firing did not comply with their policy, raising awareness about workplace bullying.
summary: In Shanghai, a new employee was briefly fired after refusing to buy breakfast for her supervisor. She shared her experience on social media, leading to public condemnation and the supervisor's termination. The company reinstated the employee and acknowledged that the firing did not comply with their policy, raising awareness about workplace bullying.
